experience: You and Jennifer both know Neil Giuliano, Carolyn Sechler, and 25 others
You both studied at Northern Arizona University
Jennifer studied at Northern Arizona University before you started
Our team has been HUSTLING lately. We've been immersed in whiteboard brainstorming, late night work sessions, and endless calls to bring some amazing new ideas to life.
Can't wait to share with you all... but for now, throwback to that one time our DC team had TOO much fun modeling for DC Inno​'s 50 on Fire photo shoot!
We had a great morning presenting for the ASU Lodestar Center for Philanthropy and Nonprofit Innovation's annual conference.
Our workshop titled, "Continuous Improvement Calls for Disruption and the F Word" definitely shook the conference up a bit!
Learn more about our talking points that we covered today here: https://lnkd.in/eJgrS-p
Special shout out to all of these amazing volunteers who assisted us today at the #lostlakefestival!  We ❤️ teachers.  #owlcrew

Hello network. I've got a friend who has the capital and needs to scale from 50 to 100 corporate-owned service-based locations next year. Needs to build process and systems around all the things (Operations, Recruitment, Training, Marketing, HR, Account, site launches, etc, etc). Anyone specialize in one or more of these areas? Or do you know someone who might? If so, please connect!

Designed and built the two-year-old nonprofit organization striving to empower the most at-risk students in our community. Responsible for researching and preparing documents for the Internal Revenue Service to obtain 501(c)(3) exemption. Developed plan for curriculum, sustainability, marketing and impact. Works with a team to deliver the most effective and efficient services to our target population. Builds strategic partnerships in the community. Collaborates with CFO to ensure company is fiscally responsible. Leads weekly meetings; joins with team to evaluate objectives and create action steps to propel the mission forward. Seeks out community resources available for  students to utilize. Mentored at-risk students in the classroom to develop proof of concept.Young Artist Society is an organization empowering future generations to pursue education, serve their community and excel using creative art. The heart of our music program is the hands on, real-world training in the music industry. While exploring music related careers, the core of the curriculum teaches that developing yourself as an artist or producer is a business. You must decide what you want to stand for and what type of “product” you want to sell. Then you must network to market and finance your project. YAS students learn difficult studio software creating a marketable skill post graduation. Mentors meet with students regularly to review their academic standings and to support goal setting with students; not only to earn a diploma, but to plan a future beyond high school. Mentors provide tutoring and resources for those who need extra academic support. The YAS team coordinates with school staff regularly to gather information to determine the successes of our students.

Achieved four promotions in four years. Leader of the team responsible for developing a $30,000 grant into a multi-million dollar state funded program; earning a 93% consumer success rate. Hand picked team members to implement the delicate expansion plan: Screened resumes, conducted interviews, hired and trained staff to fulfill contract obligations. Maintained the highest staff retention rate in agency history, established in 1974. Conducted graduate level research studies in Positive Behavior Support in order to teach staff new interventions, thus increasing contract funds by nearly $300,000. Selected for agency-wide Strategic and Quality Management Teams. Raised audit scores to a record 100%. Implemented measurable objectives into service plans to track progress of our consumers: providing proof to stakeholders and funders of successful program impact.
